page.title: 12EMPLOYMENT IN CASTLEFORD
page.content: We did a survey about people's jobs and how they have changed.Most people are in paid employment,men in full and women in part time work.Most men are manual workers,mainly in the mining industry.We found that more men than women work.Of those most are in office or shop work.We found that most people travel between 1 and 5 miles to work. Nearly all have only one job.A lot of both men and women have changed their jobs within the last ten years. This is because of changes which have taken place in local industry.Less than half would like to change their jobs.Those who would like to change would prefer outdoor work or more exciting work. On unemployment we found that 2419 males are claiming benefit and 1156 females.Also a total of 167 school leavers are unemployed compared to 13% in Great Britain as a whole.
